title.native: アウトブレイク・カンパニー

description: Having a light novel author father and an eroge illustrator mother, Kanou Shinichi is a thoroughbred otaku. However he does not have any special power except for his broad knowledge, sharp insight, and impeccable instinct about "MOE" and its products, from manga to anime to games to light novel to figures. One day he found himself transported to a fantasy world where elves live and dragons fly. And he is given a task—not to fight monster or embark on a quest, but to enhance cultural exchange by becoming a "moe missionary" in this fantasy world! He meets a palace guard who has a bit of fujoshi taste, a half-elf maid, and the empress who is a little girl. He comes up with the idea of building a school. At first it runs as a comedy but later there are serious matters that Shinichi needs to face: ethnic discrimination, social problems, conflict with neighboring countries, sabotage by opposition elements including Japanese government, etc. Can he overcome the obstacles, successfully bring "moe" culture to the fantasy world, and help the people there as well?

tags.name: Isekai
tags.description: Features characters being transported into an alternate world setting and having to adapt to their new surroundings.

tags.name: Otaku Culture
tags.description: Centers around the culture of a fanatical fan-base.

tags.name: Politics
tags.description: Centers around politics, politicians, or government activities.

tags.name: Maids
tags.description: Prominently features a character who is a maid.

tags.name: Male Protagonist
tags.description: Main character is male.

tags.name: Teacher
tags.description: Protagonist is an educator, usually in a school setting.

tags.name: Female Harem
tags.description: Main cast features the protagonist plus several female characters who are romantically interested in them.

tags.name: Language Barrier
tags.description: A barrier to communication between people who are unable to speak a common language.

tags.name: Hikikomori
tags.description: Prominently features a character who withdraws from social life, often seeking extreme isolation.

tags.name: Kemonomimi
tags.description: Prominently features humanoid characters with animal ears.

tags.name: Surreal Comedy
tags.description: Prominently features comedic moments that defy casual reasoning, resulting in illogical events.

tags.name: Magic
tags.description: Prominently features magical elements or the use of magic.

tags.name: School
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a primary or secondary educational institution.

tags.name: Elf
tags.description: Prominently features a character who is an elf.

tags.name: Parody
tags.description: Features deliberate exaggeration of popular tropes or a particular genre to comedic effect.

tags.name: Military
tags.description: Centered around the life and activities of military personnel.

tags.name: Tsundere
tags.description: Prominently features a character who acts cold and hostile in order to mask warmer emotions.

tags.name: Video Games
tags.description: Centers around characters playing video games.

tags.name: Rape
tags.description: Features non-consensual sexual penetration.

tags.name: Royal Affairs
tags.description: Features nobility, alliances, arranged marriage, succession disputes, religious orders and other elements of royal politics.

tags.name: Dragons
tags.description: Prominently features mythical reptiles which generally have wings and can breathe fire.

tags.name: Disability
tags.description: A work that features one or more characters with a physical, mental, cognitive, or developmental condition that impairs, interferes with, or limits the person's ability to engage in certain tasks or actions.

tags.name: Time Skip
tags.description: Features a gap in time used to advance the story.

node.description:
[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/荒川稔久)

Married to fellow scriptwriter [Hiroko Naka](https://anilist.co/staff/181820/).
Keiji Inai is a Japanese composer and arranger affiliated with the music production company IMAGINE.

__[Twitter](https://twitter.com/watanabesho)__ | __[Blog (jp)](https://ameblo.jp/shoooou/)__ | __[Artist Profile (Smile Company)](https://www.smile-co.jp/archives/creator/431)__

Shou Watanabe is a Japanese keyboardist, lyricist, composer, arranger and member of three-piece rock band [Sajou no Hana](https://anilist.co/staff/137163/).

__[Twitter](https://twitter.com/watanabesho)__ | __[Blog (jp)](https://ameblo.jp/shoooou/)__ | __[Artist Profile (Smile Company)](https://www.smile-co.jp/archives/creator/431)__

Shou Watanabe is a Japanese keyboardist, lyricist, composer, arranger and member of three-piece rock band [Sajou no Hana](https://anilist.co/staff/137163/).

__Agency:__ Hibiki

[Website](http://mimorin.com/) | [Profile (Hibiki Cast)](https://hibiki-cast.jp/hibiki_f/mimori_suzuko/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/mimori_suzuko)  | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/mimorin.official/) | [LINE Blog](https://lineblog.me/mimori_suzuko/)

**Non anime roles:**
- Sangonomiya Kokomi - Genshin Impact (VG)
- Match - Kirara Fantasia (VG)
- Pinkie Pie - My Little Pony Friendship is Magic (Japanese dub)
- Rapunzel - Goddess of Victory: Nikke (VG)
Originally an animator. Often works with [Hijiri Sanpei](https://anilist.co/staff/149565/).
In March 2010, she graduated from Tokyo Animation College.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/325492584) | [Sakugabooru](https://www.sakugabooru.com/post?tags=tatsuya_yoshihara)

Freelance animator formerly affiliated with [Actas](https://anilist.co/studio/60/) where he was attending its internal animation school and debuted as animator at the age of 20. His work has been greatly influenced by contemporary Kanada school animators [Seiya Numata](https://anilist.co/staff/124320/) and [Hironori Tanaka](https://anilist.co/staff/103979/). 

He's a precocious talent, debuting as episode director at the age of 21 and as director at the age of 23 with [Arve Rezzle](https://anilist.co/anime/13863/), as part of the Young Animator Training Project.

Married to fellow animator [Kikuko Sadakata](https://anilist.co/staff/105769).

George Edmond Manley is an American voice artist, adaptation writer, novelist and screenplay writer. He attended San Jose State University, majoring in theatre arts, University of Nevada, Reno, majoring in journalism and holds his associate of science degree in Computer Information Systems from Morrision University and trained at San Francisco's Voice One Studio and with Braintracks Audio's Nancy Wolfson in commercial and character voiceover.    Manley has performed voice work for several ADV Films productions, including Francesco in the second volume of Noir; Impact, the giant robot in Legend of the Mystical Ninja; Hyugi Zeravire from Super Heavyweight God Gravion Zwei; Barba from Hakugei: Legend of The Moby Dick; and the English-language narrator for Kagaku Ninjatai Gatchaman.    Additionally, he has written adaptation scripts for the last six episodes of Gantz, and is the series writer for the newest adaptation of Super Dimension Fortress Macross, 009-1, Coyote Ragtime Show, Pumpkin Scissors and Kadokawa USA's Full Metal Panic! The Second Raid.    Manley was encouraged to become a voice artist after meeting and receiving encouragement at the 2002 FanimeCon from voice artist Amanda Winn-Lee; voice artist Tiffany Grant and her husband ADV Films president Matt Greenfield.    Manley is also an on-air personality for Houston's Taping For The Blind Radio (now known as Turning Sight Into Sound Radio), currently reading the Houston Chronicle and Sports Illustrated on a weekly basis.
Also is a writer, producer and director for ADV Films and Robotboy Films.
